title: Informational Text: Text Features

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: Parts of a text that help you find and understand information, like headings, bold words, and captions.
A title at the head of a page or section of a book.
A short explanation under a picture or illustration.
A smaller title under a heading that introduces a subsection.
Thicker, darker text used to show important words.
A list at the beginning of a book showing chapters and their page numbers.
A list of key words and their definitions, usually at the back of a book.
An alphabetical list of topics with page numbers.
A labeled drawing that shows the parts of something.
A word or short phrase that names a part of a diagram or picture.
An organizer that shows information in rows and columns.
A box on a page with extra or interesting information related to the main text.
A picture that shows where places are located.
A visual organizer that shows information in rows and columns or groups.
A picture that uses bars or lines to show numbers or data.
A picture that shows what something looks like if you cut through it.

teachingNotes: Create a 'text feature scavenger hunt.' Give students a list of features (e.g., 'a bold word,' 'a caption,' 'a heading') and have them find examples in a non-fiction book or article.

sample.question: What is a heading in a book?
Why do authors use bold words?
expectedAny: to make important vocabulary stand out

sample.question: What does a caption tell us?
expectedAny: It explains a picture or photograph.
it tells what the picture shows

sample.question: What is the purpose of a table of contents?
expectedAny: To show where chapters or sections start.
to list chapters with page numbers

sample.question: How do diagrams help readers understand a topic?
expectedAny: They show the parts of something.
they help explain how something works

sample.question: What kind of information can you find in a glossary?
Why are photographs included in informational texts?
expectedAny: To show what something really looks like.
to help readers see the topic

all the pictures in the book

multiplechoice.question: Bold words in a text are usually ___.
An index at the back of a book helps you find ___.
